column4: can anyone help me get my wireless card working again (it was working, now - not so much :( )
what is your chipset (that card)
cisco
the aironet? you said now not so much--is it just not working at all or just degraded performance
the aironet, yes.  and not working at all now - was working yesterday and i don't think(!) I changed anything
was there an update/upgrade since now and then?
it shows up in "Hardware Information", but not in "Network"
hm. I definitely powercycled but i didn't update *just before* the power cycle, but possibly a day or two before
is it wlan0? what does sudo ifup wlan0 do
Ignoring unknown intrface wlan0=wlan0
ifconfig does not show it?
ifconfig -a doesn't list the wireless card
that is very odd especially since it was working just earlier
actually, lspci doesn't list it either (if it should?)
what about lsusb
but it *does* appear in System->Preferences->Hardware Information
wow - that's odd.  I unplugged/replugged it back in and now i see *two* wireless interfaces (wifi0 and eth1) - is that normal?
this is a pcmcia card? sometimes can be risky hotplugging those or was this a restart situation
yes, pcmcia.  I'm back online now though, after a hotplug - didn't work immediately after reboot a couple of times though
thanks - I'll go fiddle with it some more
not supported here
